issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
I seem to get a full rebuild each and every time I click the Run button, even without making any change to any source for config file.

My app is using Ti SDK 4.1.1 and I'm building (from within Appcelerator Studio) using CLI 5.0.3 tools. 

I think this problem has existed since the 5.0.0 at least.

h3. Actual Result
```
[INFO] :   Forcing rebuild: /Users/conny/Documents/MyTitaniumApp/build/iphone/build-manifest.json does not exist
```


h3. Expected Result
I don't know what it looks like but I would expect a line saying 'found valid existing build, will re-package and launch again...' or something similar?

comments.body:
Hi, 
I have tested this issue. I also find the same behavior . I seem to get a full rebuild each and every time I click the Run button, even without making any change to any source for config file. This is a valid issue.
Log
{code}
[INFO] :   Forcing clean build: /Users/Raju/Documents/Appcelerator_Studio_Workspace/MyAppc/build/iphone/build-manifest.json does not exist
{code}
Environment
{code}
Operating System
  Name                        = Mac OS X
  Version                     = 10.10.5
  Architecture                = 64bit
  # CPUs                      = 4
  Memory                      = 8589934592
Node.js
  Node.js Version             = 0.10.37
  npm Version                 = 1.4.28
Titanium CLI
  CLI Version                 = 5.0.5
Titanium SDK
  SDK Version                 = 5.0.2.GA
  SDK Path                    = /Users/Raju/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/5.0.2.GA
  Target Platform             = iphone
{code}

Thanks
